1.text:
The world is full of secret, underground societies,
that operate in the shadows and meet behind

9.text:
closed doors, in windowless rooms. Some believe
these societies are secretly running the world.

16.text:
Let's find out more about the organisations
that don't want to be found out.

24.text:
1. The Skull and Bones order is senior secret
society at Yale University in Connecticut,

36.text:
it's members are called Bonesmen. It was founded
in 1832 and is still running today. Membership

44.text:
is restricted to only a few highly elite individuals.
Members meet every Thursday and Sunday of

51.text:
each week in a building called The Tomb. Both
of the Bush presidents were members of the

57.text:
Skull and Bones society whilst studying at
Yale. And the majority of its other members

62.text:
have gone on to achieve great fame and fortune.
Numerous conspiracy theories surround the

68.text:
group. Some believe they are the American
branch of the infamous illuminati. But the

74.text:
most popular theory is that the CIA was formed
by members from the Skull and Bones society

80.text:
and that they still control the CIA to this
day.

83.text:
2. Next up is the Bilderberg Group, the name
for a secretive annual conference of approximately

91.text:
150 highly influential individuals, membership
is strictly by invitation only. Consisting

99.text:
of mostly prime ministers and presidents from
the most powerful countries in Europe and

105.text:
North America, these make up two thirds of
the club's membership. The other third of

110.text:
the members are said to be major international
bankers and media moguls. The club meets every

116.text:
year at secretive locations around Europe
and America, what the group discusses is kept

123.text:
top secret, but is believed that they discuss
how countries and major organisations can

130.text:
better work together to improve their economics
and defence systems. In other words they discuss

136.text:
how to run the world more economically and
efficiently. Because of the secrecy of the

141.text:
group and the high profiles of its members,
the Bilderberg Group is surrounded by controversy

149.text:
3. The Freemasonry organisation is a deeply
historic fraternity that can trace its roots

156.text:
back to stonemasons in the early 17th century.
Freemasons meet regularly and are generally

162.text:
focused on improving the lives of their members
and community, they also give heavily to charity,

169.text:
despite this they are highly secretive. Being
such a historic organisation, Freemasons perform

175.text:
various rituals during their meetings and
use secret signs and handshakes to recognise

181.text:
fellow Masons. Conspiracy theorists often
link Freemasons to groups such as the Illuminati,

189.text:
believing that they are a contributing force
to the new world order.

193.text:
4. Next up is The Knight's Templar. The Knight's
Templar were a military order setup by the

199.text:
Roman Catholic Church around 1129. The group
had a highly secretive initiation ceremony.

208.text:
Commonly adorned in distinctive white mantles
with a red cross. They were the wealthiest

213.text:
and most skilled fighters of all the Christian
Crusades. There were also non combatant members

220.text:
of the Knight's Templar who were in charge
of managing the large economic infrastructure

226.text:
throughout Christendom. The organisation created
financial techniques that were the earliest

232.text:
forms of banking. They also built many military
fortifications across Europe and the Holy

239.text:
Land. One of the most famous legends is that
the illustrious Holy Grail and possibly the

246.text:
Ark of the Covenant were discovered by the
Knight's Templar at Temple Mount.

251.text:
5. The Hashshashin were a mysterious group
of Muslim assassins that operated in the Middle

258.text:
East during the 13th century. The group was
made up of Shia Muslims who banded together

264.text:
in order to create a new utopian state. The
group heavily used guerrilla tactics in battles

271.text:
against their enemies, such as espionage,
sabotage and political assassination. They

278.text:
worked by placing highly trained moles inside
enemy strongholds, and instructed to only

284.text:
attack when the time was right. It is reported
that enemy leaders would awake in the morning

290.text:
to find a Hashshashin dagger lying on their
pillow, along with a note saying "you are

296.text:
in our grip." The group became legendary contract
killers. Even performing jobs for high profile

304.text:
individuals such as King Richard the Lionheart.
It is believed that the word "Hashshashin"

310.text:
is where the modern word "assassin" comes
from.

314.text:
6. Founded in 1957, the Cadaver Society is
a secret society based at Washington and Lee

322.text:
University in Lexington, Virginia. The group
is extremely secretive and it's membership

328.text:
and organisational structure are unknown.
The society must be very wealthy because it

334.text:
has made numerous, substantial donations to
the University itself over the years. It is

341.text:
rumoured that the Cadaver Society has a network
of underground passageways spanning throughout

347.text:
the university campus. It is believed the
society uses these tunnels to travel around

353.text:
the campus undetected. There are peculiar
small locked doors all across campus that

360.text:
seem to support this theory, such as this
one in the Leyburn Library. Some believe the

366.text: Cadaver Society to be a branch of the Illuminati.

370.text:
7. Next up is the Hermetic Order of the Golden
Dawn, not the catchiest name for a secret

377.text:
society. They were devoted to the study and
practice of the occult, metaphysics and paranormal

384.text:
activity, and everything considered magical,
during the 19th and 20th centuries. The order

391.text:
has been one of the single biggest influences
on 20th century Western occultism, such as

398.text:
8. Another infamous occultist organisation
is the Ordo Templi Orientis. It is an international

406.text:
fraternal and religious society, founded at
the begging of the 20th century. It is dedicated

412.text:
to the Law of Thelema, which was developed
by the well known British writer and occultist

419.text:
Aleister Crowley, who went by the nickname
of "Great Beast". The organisation uses highly

426.text:
stylised rituals for initiation. During their
meetings many Ancient Egyptian Gods are invoked,

432.text:
as well as the Devil. They are known for sometimes
performing their rituals completely naked.

440.text:
The Ordo Templi Orientis claims to have over
3,000 members worldwide.

446.text:
9. Rosicrucianism is a philosophical secret
society founded in late medieval Germany around

455.text:
the 16th century. Rosicrucians opposed Roman
Catholicism, rejecting the idea of Dogma and

463.text:
instead relying on evidence and experience
to form conclusions. It is believed that the

469.text:
Rosicrucians were one of the biggest influences
on the creation of Freemasonry. It is also

475.text: rumoured that Isaac Newton was a member.

479.text:
10. And finally, is of course, the Illuminati.
Originally known as the Bavarian Illuminati,

486.text:
they are a secretive group formed during the
age of enlightenment, on May 1st, 1776. The

494.text:
Illuminati's original goals were to oppose
and put an end to superstition and religious

499.text:
influence over public life. They encouraged
people to think for themselves instead of

505.text:
doing what the state and their religion tells
them to do. The Illuminati is made up of mostly

511.text:
atheists. Naturally the Roman Catholic Church
didn't take too kindly to the formation of

518.text:
the group. So in 1784 the illuminati, along
with freemasonry were outlawed by the Bavarian

527.text:
leader Charles Theodore, with the encouragement
of the Roman Catholic Church.

533.text:
However this didn't perturb the Illuminati,
they continued their meetings and pushing

538.text:
their ideologies, but now all done in top
secret. It is thought that, operating in the

545.text:
shadows, and from behind closed doors, the
Illuminati were responsible for the French

552.text:
It is thought by scholars that the Illuminati
collapsed entirely in the late 1700s. But

560.text:
some believe they are still very active to
this day. And is secretly operating and managing

566.text:
the major governments of the world and they
seek to create a One World Government based
